title: Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term) visa (subclass 482)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term) visa (subclass 482) Page Content ​​On December 7 2024, the Skills in Demand (SID) visa replaced the Temporary Skills Shortage (TSS) visa. All TSS nominations and visa applications lodged prior to the implementation of the SID visa will be processed using the requirements in force at the time the application was lodged. If your employer has lodged a TSS nomination and you have not lodged your associated TSS visa application before 7 December 2024, if the nomination is approved it will be deemed a SID nomination and you can lodge an associated application for a SID visa. About this visa Details This visa enables employers to address labour shortages by bringing in skilled workers where employers can't source an appropriately skilled Australian worker. You can stay for up to 2 years or up to 4 years if an International Trade Obligation (ITO) applies. Hong Kong passport holders may stay up to 5 years. The occupation is on the short-term skilled occupations list Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), or for people who applied for the visa on or before 06 December 2024 and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details If you already hold a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted. What this visa lets you do Details With this visa, you can: live, study and work in Australia temporarily have eligible dependant family members apply to join you in Australia Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. During your stay in Australia, you must: maintain adequate health insurance while you are in Australia continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream under which you were granted the visa leave Australia when your visa ends (unless you are granted another visa) Family members Details If your dependant family members did not apply to accompany you when you were first granted this visa, they can apply as a subsequent entrant from in or outside Australia while your visa remains valid. When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you. Your family must: intend to remain members of your family unit. maintain adequate health insurance while they are in Australia. Your family can live, travel, work and study in Australia while their visa is valid We will tell you if there are any other conditions they must comply with when you are granted the visa. Report changes in circumstances Details Tell us if your circumstances change. This includes a new residential address, a new passport, or a pregnancy, birth or death in your family. For further information, visit Changes in your situation

===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term) visa (subclass 482)

Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term) visa (subclass 482)
Page Content

​​On December 7 2024, the Skills in Demand (SID) visa replaced the Temporary Skills Shortage (TSS) visa.

​​On December 7 2024, the Skills in Demand (SID) visa replaced the Temporary Skills Shortage (TSS) visa.

All TSS nominations and visa applications lodged prior to the implementation of the SID visa will be processed using the requirements in force at the time the application was lodged.

All TSS nominations and visa applications lodged prior to the implementation of the SID visa will be processed using the requirements in force at the time the application was lodged.

If your employer has lodged a TSS nomination and you have not lodged your associated TSS visa application before 7 December 2024, if the nomination is approved it will be deemed a SID nomination and you can lodge an associated application for a SID visa.

If your employer has lodged a TSS nomination and you have not lodged your associated TSS visa application before 7 December 2024, if the nomination is approved it will be deemed a SID nomination and you can lodge an associated application for a SID visa.
​

## About this visa

About this visa
Details

This visa enables employers to address labour shortages by bringing in skilled workers where employers can't source an appropriately skilled Australian worker.

This visa enables employers to address labour shortages by bringing in skilled workers where employers can't source an appropriately skilled Australian worker.

You can stay for up to 2 years or up to 4 years if an International Trade Obligation (ITO) applies. Hong Kong passport holders may stay up to 5 years.

You can stay for up to 2 years or up to 4 years if an International Trade Obligation (ITO) applies. Hong Kong passport holders may stay up to 5 years.

The occupation is on the short-termskilled occupations list

The occupation is on the short-term
skilled occupations list

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), or for people who applied for the visa on or before 06 December 2024 and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), or for people who applied for the visa on or before 06 December 2024 and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

If you already hold a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted.

If you already hold a Temporary Skill Shortage (Short-term stream) visa (subclass 482), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

With this visa, you can:

With this visa, you can:
- live, study and work in Australia temporarily
live, study and work in Australia temporarily
- have eligible dependant family members apply to join you in Australia
have eligible dependant family members apply to join you in Australia

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

During your stay in Australia, you must:

During your stay in Australia, you must:
- maintain adequate health insurance while you are in Australia
maintain adequate health insurance while you are in Australia
- continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream under which you were granted the visa
continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream under which you were granted the visa
- leave Australia when your visa ends (unless you are granted another visa)
leave Australia when your visa ends (unless you are granted another visa)

### Family members

Family members
Details

If your dependant family members did not apply to accompany you when you were first granted this visa, they can apply as asubsequent entrantfrom in or outside Australia while your visa remains valid.

If your dependant family members did not apply to accompany you when you were first granted this visa, they can apply as a
subsequent entrant
from in or outside Australia while your visa remains valid.

When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you.

When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you.

Your family must:

Your family must:
- intend to remain members of your family unit.
intend to remain members of your family unit.
- maintainadequate health insurancewhile they are in Australia.
maintain
adequate health insurance
while they are in Australia.
- Your family can live, travel, work and study in Australia while their visa is valid
Your family can live, travel, work and study in Australia while their visa is valid

We will tell you if there are any other conditions they must comply with when you are granted the visa.

We will tell you if there are any other conditions they must comply with when you are granted the visa.

### Report changes in circumstances

Report changes in circumstances
Details

Tell us if your circumstances change. This includes a new residential address, a new passport, or a pregnancy, birth or death in your family.

Tell us if your circumstances change. This includes a new residential address, a new passport, or a pregnancy, birth or death in your family.
